intro: Boehmeria biloba, commonly known as Chinese nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Boehmeria biloba is valued for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and papermaking.
